Photons

photon.Rd

Various functionality to deal with the 4-momentum of a photon

Usage

is.consistent.nullvec(N,TOL=1e-10)
as.photon(x,E=1)

Arguments

N

Four-momentum to be tested for nullness

TOL

tolerance

x

Vector of three-velocities

E

Energy, a scalar

Details

Returns the four-momentum of a photon.

Author

Robin K. S. Hankin

See also

4mom,reflect

Examples


## A bunch of photons all approximately parallel to the x-axis:
as.photon(as.3vel(cbind(0.9,runif(10)/1000,runif(10)/1000)))
#>       E       p_x          p_y          p_z
#>  [1,] 1 0.9999995 8.022908e-04 0.0005500922
#>  [2,] 1 0.9999997 7.120238e-04 0.0003861271
#>  [3,] 1 0.9999998 4.523448e-04 0.0003571782
#>  [4,] 1 0.9999997 5.642957e-04 0.0005380022
#>  [5,] 1 0.9999996 7.766397e-05 0.0008353788
#>  [6,] 1 0.9999994 1.043438e-03 0.0003786377
#>  [7,] 1 0.9999999 3.732078e-04 0.0002147766
#>  [8,] 1 0.9999996 8.387214e-04 0.0004135300
#>  [9,] 1 0.9999997 3.791278e-04 0.0006051218
#> [10,] 1 0.9999996 6.697692e-04 0.0006383958


## mirror ball:
jj <- matrix(rnorm(30),10,3)
disco <- sweep(matrix(rnorm(30),10,3),1,sqrt(rowSums(jj^2)),`/`)
p <- as.photon(c(1,0,0))
reflect(p,disco)
#>   E         p_x        p_y         p_z
#> x 1  0.27165423  0.1897954  0.94349441
#> x 1 -0.01779091  0.4084914  0.91258875
#> x 1 -0.20186299  0.3402965 -0.91839512
#> x 1 -0.77174253 -0.3535096 -0.52862503
#> x 1 -0.51709302  0.7485216 -0.41512678
#> x 1  0.02381068 -0.8384068  0.54452461
#> x 1  0.99065220 -0.1275791 -0.04828874
#> x 1  0.97159214  0.2290419 -0.05956933
#> x 1 -0.79070950  0.5883082  0.16932785
#> x 1  0.25597926  0.7960824 -0.54838620

table(reflect(p,disco)[,2]>0) # should be TRUE with probability sqrt(0.5)
#> 
#> FALSE  TRUE 
#>     5     5 

## relativistic  disco; mirror ball moves at 0.5c:

B <- boost(as.3vel(c(0.5,0,0)))
p |> tcrossprod(B) |> reflect(disco) |> tcrossprod(solve(B))
#>           t           x           y           z
#> x 0.7572181  0.51443615  0.10957840  0.54472675
